titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10778

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Covington Aug 10. 1861
Hon. B. Magoffin Govr &c

My dear Govr. Sometime since say 6 or 8 mos there was presented for your consideration a petition unanimously signed praying the remission of a fine against R. F. Blick for illegal voting. It was one of those cases where the voting precinct had been changed all the others were remitted and there are no reasons why this should be made an exception Please refer to the petition for facts at large. Blicks is a one of our best citizens plain good man and do nothing wrong if he knew it
Will you be prepared to "see company" on the 1st Monday?

Kenton Cir Ct
$50 } Illegal voting
R. F Blick
